name: (potentially) habitabal exoplanet
description: An exoplanet that has a surface temperature that can sustain liquid water and is fairly comporable to earth in size, composition, and atmospheric properties.

name: absolute zero
description: Theoretical point where gases reach minimum enthalpy and entropy values.

name: astronomical unit
description: The averagedistance between the earth and the sun, ~93 million miles (150 million Kilometers).

name: Earth Density
description: The average density of all planetary material composing earth.

name: earth mass
description: The approximate mass of the earth.

name: earth radius
description: The average radius of earth (polar and equatorial radii).

name: exoplanet
description: A planet that exists outside of our solar system.

name: galactic coordinate system
description: A celestial coordinate system with our sun at the center.

name: Galactic Year
description: Time for our solar system to orbit the center of the Milky Way.

name: gravity
description: The effect of bent space-time.  A force that attracts all objects containing mass. {earth=9.807, sun=234, moon=1.62, jupiter=24.79}.

name: Habitable Zone
description: The area around a star that would allow water to exist in a liquid form.

name: Interstellar Travel
description: Travelling between stars (or planetary systems).

name: kelvin
description: Degrees above absolute zero, same scale as celsius but starts at theoretical freezing temperature of all matter (save quantum mechanics), not water.

name: Light Year
description: The distance which light travels in vacuum in one Julian year (365.25 days), ~9.46 trillion km/ 5.88 trillion miles.

name: Lorentz factor
description: Measures the distortion of time and space on a moving object.

name: Parsec
description: A distance scale of astronomical proportions.  210,000 astronomical units/31 trillion km/19 trillion miles.

name: planet
description: A astronomical object which orbits a star, is massive enough to become gravitationally rounded, and has cleared its surrounding area of objects not orbitting itself.

name: Planetary Equilibrium Temperature
description: The theoretical temperature of a planet if it were to absorb all the radiation from its parent star(s) that reaches its surface. Earth has an equlibrium temperature of 255K (-18c, -1f), but an actual temperature of about 288K(15c, 59f) due to greenhouse effects).

name: Planetary Habitability
description: The ability to develop and maintain environments hospitable to life

name: Proper Velocity
description: The distance per unit time where time is measured by the moving object, not a 'stationary' clock .

name: Rogue Planet
description: A planet without a star or gravitationally bounding remnant to orbit.

name: Solar Constant
description: The amount of solar energy received by earth.

name: Solar Flux/Insolation
description: The amount of solar energy reaching a planet, often measured in watts or joules/meter^2 and often over a time period. Commonly measured relative to earth (earth=1).

name: Solar Mass
description: The approximate mass of the sun.

name: Solar Radius
description: The radius of the sun; 432,300 miles ( ~10 * radius of jupiter, 109 * earth).

name: Tidal Lock
description: when an orbiting astronomical body rotates on its own axis at the same rate it orbits its host, resulting in the same side always facing the object it is orbiting.
